substitution.copyText: " Whose violent property foregoes it self, | " And leads the will to desperate undertakings, | " As oft as any passion under heaven | " That does afflict our natures: I am sorry;

" I am sorry that with better head and judgment | " I had not coated him; I fear'd he did but trifle, | " And meant to wrack thee, but beshrew my jealousie; | " By heaven it is as proper to our age | " To cast beyond ourselves in our opinions, | " As it is common for the younger sort | " To lack discretion: " Come, go with me to the King.
substitution.amendedText: Come, go with me to the King.

substitution.copyText: Of Hamlet's transformation, so call it; | Sith not th'exterior, nor the inward man | Resembles that it was: what it should be
substitution.amendedText: Of Hamlet's transformation, | what it should be

substitution.copyText: More than his fathers death, that thus hath put him | So much from the understanding of himself
That being of so young days brought up with him, | " And sith so neighboured to his youth and behaviour, | That you vouchsafe your rest here in our Court
